intro: Pholidia woollsiana, commonly known as the Woolly Pholidia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough, hairy texture, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
